function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Potential privacy concerns with the collection and storage of personal health data through mobile applications.","Impact":"Risk of data breaches, unauthorized access, or misuse of personal health data, leading to privacy violations and loss of trust in the application.","Mitigation":"Implementation of robust data security measures, user consent for data collection, and adherence to data protection regulations.","Technologies":"Encryption technologies, secure data storage solutions, and privacy-preserving data collection methods.","People":"Users of the mobile applications, individuals whose health data is collected, and the general public.","Owner":"Developers of the mobile applications, regulatory authorities, and data protection agencies."},{"Description":"Risk of missed exposure and contact tracing due to the absence of mobile phones or mobile service.","Impact":"Increased difficulty in identifying and notifying contacts of infected individuals, potentially leading to higher transmission rates and more severe COVID-19 outbreaks.","Mitigation":"Public health education on the importance of carrying mobile phones for contact tracing, alternative contact tracing methods for individuals without access to mobile phones, and increased support for mobile phone access.","Technologies":"SMS-based contact tracing, alternative Bluetooth tracking devices, and community-based contact tracing initiatives.","People":"Individuals without access to mobile phones or mobile service, public health authorities responsible for contact tracing, and the general public.","Owner":"Public health authorities, telecommunications companies, and community organizations."},{"Description":"Low adoption rates of contact tracing applications leading to reduced effectiveness of the mitigation strategy.","Impact":"Limited ability to identify and notify contacts of infected individuals, resulting in less effective containment of COVID-19 transmission and outbreaks.","Mitigation":"Promotion of contact tracing applications through public health campaigns, incentives for application usage, and addressing concerns about data privacy and security.","Technologies":"Social media platforms, targeted advertising, and public awareness campaigns.","People":"General public, public health officials, and policymakers responsible for public health interventions.","Owner":"Public health authorities, government agencies, and digital marketing firms."}]}
